  physical_appearance: An upright ladder cuts across the image. To its right lies a raised wooden plank
 where a man in cap sits with his left leg raised. He anchors this stance by supporting himself with a plank. The man is fellow artist
 Yip Cheong Fan. A long shadow of the ladder is casted to the left of the image. On the verso
 there is a Biennale Di Genova chop
 as well as the artist\u0027s photography studio chop and title of work.

  sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time
 with an emphasis on technique
 composition and tone. The subject in this photo is fellow photographer Yip Cheong Fun.

metadata.physical_appearance: An upright ladder cuts across the image. To its right lies a raised wooden plank, where a man in cap sits with his left leg raised. He anchors this stance by supporting himself with a plank. The man is fellow artist, Yip Cheong Fan. A long shadow of the ladder is casted to the left of the image. On the verso, there is a Biennale Di Genova chop, as well as the artist's photography studio chop and title of work.

metadata.sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. These photos are typical of the salon photography style of the time, with an emphasis on technique, composition and tone. The subject in this photo is fellow photographer Yip Cheong Fun.
